question: Which disease is associated with DNAJB1-PRKACA fusion gene?
ideal_answer: Fibrolamellar carcinoma is distinctive at clinical and histologic levels. A novel DNAJB1-PRKACA fusion gene characterizes almost all cases.

snippets.text: DNAJB1-PRKACA fusion gene found in sporadic fibrolamellar carcinomas,
the presence of a characteristic DNAJB1-PRKACA fusion gene has been associated with FLC.
The fibrolamellar carcinoma-associated DNAJB1-PRKACA gene fusion transcript RNA codes for the catalytic domain of protein kinase A and, thus, overexpression of Aurora kinase A.

Fibrolamellar carcinoma is distinctive at clinical and histologic levels. A novel DNAJB1-PRKACA fusion gene characterizes almost all cases, distinguishes it from other hepatocellular neoplasms, and drives the pathogenesis of this unique tumor
